origination.corpname: North Russia Expeditionary Force. Mapping Section.

did.abstract: Maps created for the Allied intervention in Russia, 1918-1919, the "Polar Bear Expedition."

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The collection was donated by Mrs. Roy Worden, of Jackson, Michigan, in 1966 (Donor No. 4376), and Hugo Salchow, of Southfield, Michigan, in 1972 (Donor No. 5216).

accruals.p: No further additions to the collection are expected.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

userestrict.p: Copyright is not held by the Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: item, folder title, box. no., North Russia Expeditionary Force. Mapping Section. [Maps of Archangel District, Russia], 4th ser., [1918?], Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

scopecontent.p: The collection contains maps (Scale 1:420,000) of the district of Archangel, Russia created by engineers of the Allied intervention in North Russia, the N.R.E.F. Mapping Section. The Bentley Historical Library has only a partial set of these maps.
